title: Quadrature Amplitude Modulation (QAM)

steps.title: QAM Signal Definition
steps.description: QAM combines two independent signals using quadrature carriers
steps.equation: s_{QAM}(t) = I(t) \cos(2\pi f_c t) - Q(t) \sin(2\pi f_c t)
steps.explanation: I(t) is in-phase component, Q(t) is quadrature component

steps.title: Orthogonality of Carriers
steps.description: The carriers are orthogonal over one symbol period T
steps.explanation: This allows independent recovery of I and Q at the receiver

steps.title: I Component Recovery
steps.description: Multiply by cos(2πf_c t) and integrate
steps.explanation: The Q component integrates to zero due to orthogonality

steps.title: Q Component Recovery
steps.explanation: The I component integrates to zero, recovering Q independently

final_formula: s_{QAM}(t) = I(t) \cos(2\pi f_c t) - Q(t) \sin(2\pi f_c t)
key_results: Orthogonal carriers enable independent I-Q channels
M-QAM transmits log₂(M) bits per symbol
Widely used in WiFi, LTE, cable modems
